subject: Creativity
title: The 70-20-10 Rule: Google's Innovation Budget
description: A quick win: understand The 70-20-10 Rule: Google's Innovation Budget.

hook.text: Google allocates resources: 70% to core business, 20% to adjacent innovations, 10% to moonshots.

buildup.text: The 70-20-10 model ensures a company innovates at three speeds simultaneously: optimizing today, extending tomorrow.

discovery.text: Most companies spend 95%+ on core business and near-zero on moonshots.

twist.text: Amazon's Jeff Bezos operates similarly: 'If you're going to invent, you're going to fail.

climax.text: The 10% moonshot budget requires accepting that most experiments will fail.

punchline.text: Spend 70% on what works. Spend 10% on what seems crazy.

quiz.question: What does the '10%' in Google's 70-20-10 rule fund?
